did.head: Descriptive Summary
did.unittitle: Prince William County (Va.) Administrators' Bond Book, 1753-1782
did.physloc: State Records Center - Archives Annex, Library of Virginia

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Prince William County (Va.) Administrators' Bond Book, 1753-1782. Local Government Records Collection, Prince William County Court Records. The Library of Virginia, Richmond, Va. 23219.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: This volume came to the Library of Virginia under the accession number 31262.

bioghist.head: Historical Information
bioghist.p: Prince William County was formed from Stafford and King George Counties by a statute adopted in 1730, to take effect on 12 March 1731. The county was named for William Augustus, duke of Cumberland and third son of King George II.
This volume was originally created by the County Court.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content
scopecontent.p: Prince William County (Va.) Administrators' Bond Book covers the years 1753-1782. An Administrator is a person appointed by the court to manage the assets and liabilities of a person who dies without having written a valid will. An administrator may also be appointed if the testator leaves an incomplete will naming no executor, or if the named executor cannot or will not serve.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Additional Prince William County Records can be found on microfilm at the Library of Virginia. Consult "A Guide to Virginia County and City Records on Microfilm"

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Prince William County is one of Virginia's Lost Records Localities. Additional Prince William Court Records may be found in the Virginia Lost Records Localities Collection at the Library of Virginia. Search the Lost Records Localites Database found on the Library of Virginia's web site.
